intro: Massonia roggeveldensis, commonly known as the Roggeveld massonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and xeriscapes.
